results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/25]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Sports - competitors from five nations in the Paris-Strasbourg “walkathon”. 2. Techniques - the new, ultra-modern “Etendard” express train, linking Paris to Bordeaux in four and a half hours. 3. At Arzwiller, a new Moselle River “boat-lift”, doing the work of ten locks. 4. Plane and helicopter rotor-research at the Modane Onera wind-tunnel. 5. The bulls of Camargue - cattle-rustling in Camargue. 6. European art - sponsored by the European Economic Council, an exhibition on “European art in 1925”.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/23]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. A new city - about a “prime example” of modern city planning in the city of Sarcelles. A city that began as a major housing project but which became a city in its own right. 2. Techniques “Expomar” - an expo of machinery and other techniques relevant to urban planning. Mirabelle - about MIR506, destined for the Soviet Union. 3. Francois Tracanelli - pole vault champion. 4. The arts: an art gallery featuring lithographs. Also featuring lithographs and sculpture of Ossip Zadkine.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/21]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. 28th Grand Prix at Monaco won by Jochen Rindt (Austria) beating Jack Brabham (Australia). 2. Filmed performace extracts of gymnasts from the Republican Guard. 3. Indian students present a folk loric show. 4. Examination of the techniques used by the Central Hydraulic Laboratory when researching harbours. 5. Two art exhibitions - Delacroix in Paris and Picasso in Avignon (all his paintings of his 88th year).

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/20]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazaine items including: 1. For sportslovers - a new stadium on the banks of the Seine houses 5,400 spectators and has facilities for volley-ball, boxing, rowing, gymnastics, Japanese martial arts etc. 2. Chemistry and industry - an exhibition showcasing the chemical industry. 3. Le Havre Municipal Recreation Centre. 4. Art market - the galleries and auction rooms of Paris. 5. Space robot (an electrified sculpture). 6. New sitting of the Chambre des Deputies. 7. Sports and champions - France vs USSR in swimming - Georges Pompidou, Maurice Schumann. 8. Homage to Leon Poirier - tribute to a mayor of Perigord who had been a pioneer filmmaker. 9. The Avant-Garde School - “La Saurce” an innovative school near Paris. 10. The Treasure of the Devil - story of a priest who spent a fortune restoring old buildings in a village in central France.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/18]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Osaka-70 - the World Fair in Osaka focusing mainly on the French Pavillion. 2. Brest et Saint-Nazaire - the rebuilt port and city of Brest after almost complete destruction during WWII. Focuses mainly on the ship building industry and the university.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/14]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. International cross-country championships - the English, led by Mike Taggs, are brilliant winners, with the French team taking second place ahead of Belgium. 2. Andre Marchand and Mexico - Andre Marchand, an artist from Provence, exhibits in Paris the canvases he painted in Mexico. 3. Fashions down through the generations - at the Nissim de Camondo Museum in Paris, collections patiently assembled by the French Costume Arts Union are on display. 4. Leonard Bernstein - American musician, composer, instrumentalist, and orchestra conductor, Leonard Bernstein conquers the hearts of Paris music lovers. 5. French filmmaker Henri-Georges Clouzot - the French master of film suspense, author of “Le Salaire de la Peur” and “Les Diaboliques” gives us his ideas on life and the cinema. 6. Bird’s eye view of fashions - Paris Spring fashions take wing in the skies of France’s capital.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 70/13]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. In the news: Mr Pompidou visits the new UNESCO installations. The turbo-train goes into service. 2. Metros galore - the Paris Metro on the export market. 3. March summer - the Guyana Space Center and the launching of the German “Dial” satellite with a French Diamond B booster. 4. Canada in Paris - the “from Raphael to Picasso”, a Canadian exhibition in Paris.
